result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin R. Heier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant must submit a DNA sample.  Defendant must write a letter of apology to all of the victims, due within 30 days and pre-approved by agent.  Defendant must attend counseling as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant shall be eligible for expungement. Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Undergo an AODA assessment and participate in treatment as recommended.

DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation

Defendant Benjamin R. Heier in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement placed on the record by Atty Tlusty.  Victim rights complied. DE entered a plea of no contest to the charge.  Plea colloquy.  Factual basis exists. Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty.  Court imposed a withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for 1 year with the following conditions: Court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; Letter of apology to victims due within 30 days and pre-approved by agent; AODA; 20 hours community service; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; restitution and surcharge, due within 30 days; eligible for expungement. ba
